revised_title: Roman Sudatory or Hypocaustum: An Archaeological Discovery at Wroxeter
tldr: This article describes the discovery of a Roman sudatory or hypocaustum at Wroxeter in Shropshire in 1701. The structure, built with brick pillars and a double floor, was likely used as a sweating house for Roman soldiers. The author provides detailed descriptions and illustrations of the structure and its components, offering insights into ancient Roman engineering and architecture.
